intro: Phylica gnidioides, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a leathery texture. Phylica gnidioides is adapted to Mediterranean climates and thrives in well-drained soils.
